text: my name is Ryan Quackenbush and I run a
community and advocacy program at
aprenda now our goal getting into this
and sort of driving initiative is really
all about cultivating and engage
community now we do this through
something called challenges which our
activities meant to hone in on all of
the different sites and sources that the
cooper Nettie's project uses and
a little bit of context with that so a
couple of months ago we had a
conversation with Sarah Novotny about
the need to engage the community more
but more importantly to create a tool
that would help to shine a light on the
individual contributions made by all of
you so we have a program in place at
aprenda today that does something very
similar to this so when we heard that
there might be an interest in gamifying
the cooper Nettie's project to a degree
we got very excited because we knew this
is an area that we could help with now
when you think of the Kate sport I want
you to think of it as a central platform
that hones in on the activities of the
contributors to the Cooper Nettie's
project across multiple sites and
sources you do this through challenges
and as you complete these challenges you
will gain points and as you gain points
you will move up community tears you
will learn performance-related badges
you will participate in this fun
leaderboard in which you can see i am
number three for the sake of the demo
and
the more points you get the more
recognition you get the more status you
get the more activities that you will be
invited to participate in now what do
these challenges consist of they look
like this but they are not limited to
this so let's say you participate in a
certain number of meetups or you travel
all the way to khoob con you might earn
performance-related badges for these
sorts of things you will be encouraged
to network with everyone else in the
community that might be something as
simple as jumping on social media
sharing somebody's blog commenting on a
demo that somebody has recently created
and you will also be asked to go to
stack overflow and answer one of the
many different question that are they're
related to Coober Nettie's speaking of
this is some information that i pulled
late last week and as you can see over
sixty percent of the questions related
to cooper Nettie's over the past 30 days
are as yet unanswered so there is a huge
need for a knowledge drop for people who
might be seeking a little bit of help
from the smartest people related to
Coober Nettie's on the planet that is
all of you now I'm not saying that stack
overflow will be the central focus of
the kates board but it will be one of
the objectives to take the percentage of
answered questions push it up and more
importantly to maintain it there now
stack overflow is great social media is
wonderful and coming to coop con
obviously is great too but the real meat
and potatoes of the Kate sport has to do
with the full integration that we have
developed at github so you don't have to
create a new account nobody wants to
create a new account so if you are
contributing member to Cooper Nettie's
and you have an active github account
tied to the Cooper Nettie's repo you can
automatically authenticate using your
github credentials and gain access to
the Kate sport now it's really in
everybody's best interest to do so
because once you link the two together
you will begin automatically earning
points for all the different
contributions you make there and this
will consist of things like commits pull
requests issues reviews really anything
that we want to to to to earn points for
we can and you know everybody here is
contributing to the Cooper Nettie's
project we're all contributors right but
the Kate sport is going to be a tool to
give you a unique view on exactly how
that works you'll see your contributions
you will see the contributions of other
people and you'll get a general sense of
the overall progress of the Cooper
Nettie's project which i think is pretty
cool but what is the nitty-gritty what
is the call to action we are looking to
roll out the Kate sport to the entire
contributing community by the end of the
year but before we do that i'm looking
to onboard the the next group of
participants in the kate sport now that
is really all of you success is
essentially up to everybody in this room
right so if you are interested in being
a part of this if you are interested in
putting your stamp on this then I
encourage you reach out to me at one of
these of one of these fine locations
whether that's jumping on Twitter
whether that's sending me a personal
email you can even go to this custom
wufu URL which is an interesting URL and
you can leave your name and your email
there and I will reach out to you
directly on a personal note I just want
to say how cool it is to get out onstage
and present the coop con it's been a lot
of fun getting here Kelsey Hightower
backstage actually mistook me for the
sound guy when I walked back there
and i feel kind of since i'm the last
lightning talk i feel like i'm kind of
like a high school rock band leading
into Led Zeppelin but again thank you
guys very much in please I encourage you
to come talk to me
[Applause]
